Version 1.3
Zanmantou JSAPI

WARNING: JS DISABLED

Class: Zanmantou

Namespace: /

Extends: -

Implements: Options, Events

Zanmantou3 WebAudioVideoPlayer Javascript API (MooTools Version AND Generic/Framework independent)
  • The function console.log() is provided by Firebug (Firefox Plugin), InternetExplorer Developer Tools, Safari Developer Tools or Opera Console
  • The `MooTools`-Version requires MooTools-CORE `and` Hash from MooTools-MORE
  • The GenericAPI is tested with jQuery and as standalone application
  • The functions `addEvent` and `removeEvent` are a custom event implementation inspired by MooTools Event Handling (addEvents/removeEvents from MooTools are NOT avaible!)
  • The API requires the functions `JSON.encode` and `JSON.decode` from e.g. MooTools. The Generic Version is avaible with or without an implementation (some other frameworks have similar methods)

Syntax

var player = new Zanmantou(el, [options]);

Arguments

  1. {String|Object} Zanmantou object ElementID/Element
  2. {Object} No options avaible yet

Example

HTML - Player HTML Object with ID
JS - Create player instance with MooTools (Warning: Use the `flashready` event `NOT domready or load` !!!)
window.addEvent('flashready', function(){
 	var player = new Zanmantou('player1id');
 });
JS - Create player instance with jQuery (Warning: Don't use the `load` or `ready` event !!!)
a3non_zanmantou_flashready = (function(){
 	var player = new Zanmantou('player1id');
 });
JS - Create player instance without a Framework
a3non_zanmantou_flashready = (function(){
 	var player = new Zanmantou('player1id');
 });

Methods

.addEvent()

Adds an event to the Class instance's event stack (inspired by MooTools Event handling)
  • For cross-framework-compatibility we use a custom event implementation

Syntax

addEvent(event, fn)

Arguments

  1. event {String} The Event name/type (identifier)
  2. fn {Function} Callback function

Example

JS - XMLReady event
player1.addEvent('xmlready', function(){
 	console.log('Medialist', player1.getMediaList()):
 });

.removeEvent()

Removes an event from the stack of events of the Class instance (inspired by MooTools Event handling)
  • For cross-framework-compatibility we use a custom event implementation

Syntax

removeEvent(event, fn)

Arguments

  1. event {String} The Event name/type (identifier)
  2. fn {Function} Callback function

Example

JS - XMLReady event
// Callback function
 var onXMLReady = function(){
 	console.log("XML data is avaible");
 });

 // adding event
 player1.addEvent('xmlready', onXMLReady);

 // remove event
 player1.removeEvent('xmlready', onXMLReady)

.start()

Starts playback, equivalent to UI start button

Syntax

start()

Example

HTML - Create a HTML baased start-button
Start Playback
JS - Add Click-event (MooTools)
$('zanmantou_start').addEvent('click', function(){
 	player1.start();
 });

.jumpAndStart()

Jump to media item item given by index

Syntax

jumpAndStart(index)

Arguments

  1. index {INT} the destination media index (0....n-1)

Example

JS - Start item on index 14 (track 15 !)
player.jumpAndStart(14);

.seek()

Seek media pointer to specified position

Syntax

seek(pos)

Arguments

  1. pos {Int} new position in seconds

.play()

LOWLEVEL: Directly play a track by given URL

Syntax

play(url, type, position)

Arguments

  1. url {String} absolute URL to the media file
  2. type {String} media type (audio|video)
  3. position {Int} start position in seconds (normally 0)

Example

JS - Play Video from a3non.org
player1.play('http://www.a3non.org/media/demo.f4v', 'video', 0);

.stop()

Stops playback, equivalent to UI stop button

Syntax

stop()

.pause()

Pause playback, equivalent to UI pause button

Syntax

pause()

.next()

Jumps to next media item, equivalent to UI next button

Syntax

next()

.prev()

Jumps to previous media item, equivalent to UI prev button

Syntax

prev()

.shuffle()

Enable/Disable shuffle mode, equivalent to UI shuffle button

Syntax

shuffle(e)

Arguments

  1. e {Boolean} enable shuffle

.repeat()

Enable/Disable single item repeat mode, equivalent to UI repeat button

Syntax

repeat(e)

Arguments

  1. e {Boolean} enable repeat

.repeatall()

Enable/Disable repeatall mode, equivalent to UI repeatall button

Syntax

repeatall(e)

Arguments

  1. e {Boolean} enable repeatall

.smoothing()

Enable/Disable video smoothing, equivalent to UI smoothing button
WARNING: Enabling this options causes extrem CPU load when playing HD videos

Syntax

smoothing(e)

Arguments

  1. e {Boolean} enable smoothing

.mute()

Mutes volume, equivalent to UI mute button

Syntax

mute()

.unmute()

Unmutes volume, equivalent to UI unmute button

Syntax

unmute()

.setVolume()

Set volume

Syntax

setVolume(volume)

Arguments

  1. volume {Double} normalized to [0.0 ... 1.0]

Example

JS - Set volume to 50%
player.setVolume(0.5);

.getVolume()

Get volume

Syntax

getVolume()

Returns

  • volume {Double} normalized to [0.0 ... 1.0]

.setPan()

Set pan (LR balance)

Syntax

setPan(pan)

Arguments

  1. pan {Double} normalized to [-1.0 ... 0.0 ... 1.0] negative values represent left, positive right

.getPan()

Get pan (LR balance)

Syntax

getPan()

Returns

  • pan {Double} normalized to [-1.0 ... 0.0 ... 1.0] negative values represent left, positive right

.setLRTransform()

Set LR transformation (LR channel mix)

Syntax

setLRTransform(ll, lr, rr, rl)

Reference

  1. http://livedocs.adobe.com/flex/3/langref/flash/media/SoundTransform.html

Arguments

  1. ll {Double} left to left mix normalized to [0.0 ... 1.0]
  2. lr {Double} left to right mix normalized to [0.0 ... 1.0]
  3. rr {Double} right to right mix normalized to [0.0 ... 1.0]
  4. rl {Double} right to left mix normalized to [0.0 ... 1.0]

Example

JS - Transform to Mono Sound
player1.setLRTransform(0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5);

.getWave()

LOWLEVEL: Get waveform snapshot (FFT=false)

Syntax

getWave()

Reference

  1. http://livedocs.adobe.com/flex/3/langref/flash/media/SoundMixer.html#computeSpectrum%28%29

Returns

  • {Array} array of double values (512) normalized to [-1.0 .. 0.0 .. 1.0]. the first 256 values represents the left channel, the last 256 values the right channel

.getSpectrum()

LOWLEVEL: Get spectrum snapshot (FFT=true) - you can use it to create custom spectrum visualizer

Syntax

getSpectrum()

Reference

  1. http://livedocs.adobe.com/flex/3/langref/flash/media/SoundMixer.html#computeSpectrum%28%29

Returns

  • {Array} array of double values (512) normalized to [-1.0 .. 0.0 .. 1.0]. the first 256 values represents the left channel, the last 256 values the right channel

.getMediaList()

Get the Medialist
Note: The Medialist data is only avaible when the xmlready event is fired

Syntax

getMediaList()

Returns

  • {Array} Medialist object array

Example

JS - The method returns the following object structure
var list = player.getMediaList();

 // the variable "list" contains the following structure
 [
 	{
 		source: 'mytrack.mp3',
 		streaming: false,
 		type: 'audio',
 		params: {
 			title: 'Jamtoo - Sunshine',
 			author: 'Jamtoo',
 			album: 'unknown'
		}
 	},
 
 	{
 		source: 'demovideo.f4v',
 		streaming: false,
 		type: 'video',
 		params: {
 			title: 'Zanmantou Demo Video'
		}
 	}
 ]

.setMediaList()

Set the Medialist
Note: The Medialist data is only avaible after the xmlready event. When you modify it before, it will be overwritten by the XML data!

Syntax

setMediaList(list)

Arguments

  1. list {Array} Medialist object array

Example

JS - Set new static Medialist
// create Medialist example object
 var newlist = [
 	{
 		source: 'mytrack.mp3',
 		streaming: false,
 		type: 'audio',
 		params: {
 			title: 'Jamtoo - Sunshine',
 			author: 'Jamtoo',
 			album: 'unknown'
		}
 	},
 
 	{
 		source: 'demovideo.f4v',
 		streaming: false,
 		type: 'video',
 		params: {
 			title: 'Zanmantou Demo Video'
		}
 	}
 ];

 player.setMediaList(list);

.setMediaIndex()

Set the media index

Syntax

setMediaIndex(i)

Arguments

  1. i {Int} Media Index starting with 0

.getMediaIndex()

Get the media index

Syntax

getMediaIndex()

Returns

  • {Int} Media Index starting with 0

.addMediaItem()

Add new MediaItem to the Medialist at specified index (existing element on these position is shiftet to index+1)
Note: The Medialist data is only avaible after the xmlready event. When you modify it before, it will be overwritten by the XML data!

Syntax

addMediaItem(index, data)

Arguments

  1. index {Int} MediaItem position starting with 0
  2. data {Object} new MediaItem

Example

JS - Adding new item as second element
var newitem = {
 		source: 'demovideo.f4v',
 		streaming: false,
 		type: 'video',
 		params: {
 			title: 'Zanmantou Demo Video'
		}
 	};

 player.addMediaItem(1, newitem);

.removeMediaItem()

Removes MediaItem from spcified index
Note: The Medialist data is only avaible after the xmlready event. When you modify it before, it will be overwritten by the XML data!

Syntax

removeMediaItem(index)

Arguments

  1. index {Int} Media Index starting with 0

.getFPS()

Get Video FPS (Frames per second)

Syntax

getFPS()

Returns

  • {Int} FPS

Example

HTML - FPS display
-
JS - Periodical FPS display update (MooTools)
(function(){
 	$('fpsdisplay').set('text', player.getFPS());
 }).periodical(100);

.getVisionLightColors()

Get VisionLight RAW Color Data of each border (top, right, bottom, left) if enabled, otherwise the last analyzed values

Syntax

getVisionLightColors()

Returns

  • {Object} VisionLight color object

Example

JS - Get the mean border colors
var colors = player.getVisionLightColors();

 // the object contains max. 4 arrays (configured in your config.xml)
 // possible keys are : l,r,t,b (left, right, top, bottom)
 // every key contains an array with 3 color values (RGB)

 // the colors object contains e.g.
 {
 	r: [255, 0, 123],
 	l: [12, 34, 51],
 	t: [0, 21, 93],
 	b: [0, 0, 0]
 }

.enableVisionLight()

Enable/Disable VisionLight, equivalent to UI visionlight button

Syntax

player.enableVisionLight(true)

Arguments

  1. {Boolean} enable visionlight

exten

Fired when the GUI previous-button is clicked or the js function is called

Syntax

addEvent('extern', function(type){})

Arguments

  1. type {String} custom type identifier defined in your XML config

Example

XML - UIConfig button definition

 	special.png
JS - Capture custom event
player.addEvent('extern', function(type){
 	if (type=='myEventA1'){
 		console.log('special event A1');
 	}
 	if (type=='myEventB1'){
 		console.log('well another custom event');
 	}
 });

volumestart

Fired when the GUI volume slider was dragged

Syntax

addEvent('volumestart', function(){})

volumecomplete

Fired when the GUI volume slider has dropped

Syntax

addEvent('volumecomplete', function(value){})

Reference

  1. http://mootools.net/docs/more/Drag/Slider

Arguments

  1. value {Double} volume value normalized to [0.0 ... 1.0]

Example

JS - Using the VolumeComplete-Event to update a Javascript slider for synchronizing GUIs (see MooTools More for details)
// create player instance
 var player = new Zanmantou('myplayer');

 // create MooTools Slider
 var mySlider = new Slider('myElement', 'myKnob',{
 	range: [0,100]
 });
 
 // slider complete callback
 var slideComplete = function(value){
 	// normalizing factor (see slider range)
 	n = 100;

 	// update player volume by javascript slider
 	player.setVolume(value/n);
 }

 // add complete event
 mySlider.addEvent('complete', slideComplete);

 // update slider position on volumecomplete
 player.addEvent('volumecomplete', function(value){
 	// normalizing factor (see slider range)
 	n = 100;

 	// IMPORTANT !! to prevent infinite event loops you have to remove the complete 
 	// event from the slider, because it's fired by setting an new value. 
 	// Otherwise the Slider.set method will trigger an complete event 
 	// => player volume was updated by callback => zanmantou triggers new  
 	// volumecomplete event => ...
 	mySlider.removeEvent('complete', slideComplete);

 	// update slider value
 	mySlider.set(value*n);

 	// reattach event
 	mySlider.addEvent('complete', slideComplete);
 });

progresstart

Fired when the GUI progress slider was dragged

addEvent('progressstart', function(){})

progresscomplete

Fired when the GUI progress slider has dropped

mediacomplete

Fired when the playback of a media item (track/video) is complete

Syntax

addEvent('mediacomplete', function(){})

mediaerror

Fired when the playback of a media item failed

Syntax

addEvent('mediaerror', function(){})

Example

JS - Show error message on error
player.addEvent('mediaerror', function(){
 	alert('We are sorry but a problem occured');
 });
